meanings.definition: The quality or state of being intolerable.
meanings.sent1: The intolerableness of the situation made it impossible to continue.
meanings.sent2: The intolerableness of the noise was too much for her sensitive ears.
meanings.sent3: The intolerableness of the spicy food left him reaching for a glass of milk.
meanings.sent4: The intolerableness of the heat was like being trapped in an oven.
meanings.sent5: The intolerableness of the pain was etched on her face.

meanings.definition: The inability to endure or withstand something.
meanings.sent1: She felt the intolerableness of the weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The intolerableness of the cold made him shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The intolerableness of waiting in line felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent4: The intolerableness of the storm was like nature's fury unleashed.
meanings.sent5: The intolerableness of the sadness weighed heavily on his heart.
